SEPMaths¶

Author: Marcel Simader

Date: 01.04.2021

class SEPModules.SEPMaths.Rational(a: Union[int, float, SEPModules.SEPMaths.Rational] = 1, b: int = 1)¶

Rational number of the form \(a/b\quad(a, b \in \mathbb{Z})\). Used for symbolic computations in SEPMaths module. Values are automatically simplified. The following forms are accepted, where option 1 and 3 are exact and option 2 will approximate the float input as integer ratio:

  1. Rational(int, int)

  2. Rational(float, 1) or Rational(float)

  3. Rational(rational_instance, 1) or Rational(rational_instance)

Parameters

  • a – may be an int, float or Rational

  • b – may be an int if a is an int, otherwise should be 1 or left out

Raises

ValueError – if the denominator b is set to 0

__eq__(other) → bool¶

Return self==value.

__ge__(other) → bool¶

Return self>=value.

__gt__(other) → bool¶

Return self>value.

__hash__()¶

Return hash(self).

__init__(a: Union[int, float, SEPModules.SEPMaths.Rational] = 1, b: int = 1)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

__le__(other) → bool¶

Return self<=value.

__lt__(other) → bool¶

Return self<value.

__repr__() → str¶

Return repr(self).

static __simplify__(a: int, b: int) → Tuple[int, int]¶

Takes in a tuple \((a, b)\) for integers a and b and returns a simplified tuple \((c, d)\) where \(a/b\equiv c/d\).

__str__() → str¶

Return str(self).

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

SEPModules.SEPMaths.find_rational_approximation(num: numbers.Real, precision: int = 4) → SEPModules.SEPMaths.Rational¶

Returns a Rational x with numerator and denominator a, b where \(\text{float}(x) = a/b \approx \text{num}\).

Parameters

  • num – the number to approximate as float or int

  • precision – the number of decimal digits of precision, if this exceeds the limits of the floating point architecture of the system, this value is truncated to this maximum

Raises

ValueError – if precision is negative

SEPModules.SEPMaths.get_possible_rationals(_set: Union[list, set]) → Set[SEPModules.SEPMaths.Rational]¶

Returns unique Rationals in a set with \(a/b \quad \forall a, b \in \text{_set}\).

Parameters

_set – all elements of _set must be integers.

Raises

ValueError – if elements of _set are not all integers

SEPModules.SEPMaths.is_abelian_group(_set: Union[list, set], operator: Callable[[Any, Any], Any], tolerance: int = 0) → bool¶

Works the same way as is_group() but tests for Abelian groups.

SEPModules.SEPMaths.is_group(_set: Union[list, set], operator: Callable[[Any, Any], Any], tolerance: int = 0, abelian: bool = False) → bool¶

Test if a set and an operator form a group.

Parameters

  • operator – described by a function of form (a, b) -> (c)

  • tolerance – a value from 0 to 10, where 0 is the least and 10 is the most tolerance in floating point precision

  • abelian – test for a regular or an abelian group

Raises

ValueError – if tolerance is not between 0 and 10

SEPModules.SEPMaths.sign(x: int, zero: int = 0) → int¶

Returns the sign of x, where sign(0) = zero.

Parameters

zero – defaults to 0, but 1 may be useful in certain applications
